title: ENG09_pt 1: How This Course Works & Suggested Timeline | SVHS

mainContent.text:
How This Course Works  & Suggested Timeline

        Completion requirements
        



SVHS courses are broken down into units; we recommend that you focus on each unit at a time; don't move on to the next unit until you have completed all the quizzes, submitted your unit assignment, and taken your unit test.  Focusing on each unit
    will help you remember it better.  Do the unit assignment before the unit test; the assignment requires you to apply the information you learned in the unit, and you'll be better prepared for the test.  

Here is a brief overview of how our courses work:

Suggested Timeline For Taking The Course

All our courses are self-paced; students can take them over a minimum of 30 days or a maximum of a year. Many students take the course over the summer, while others take it over a semester. The timeline below assumes the course is being taken over a regular semester of 18 weeks. If you want to take this over the summer, adjust the timeline, do 2-3 weeks of work per week, and complete the course in 6-9 weeks.To complete this course over one semester (18 weeks), you should complete a unit every 2-3 weeks and spend 4 hours a week on the course. Remember, every student is different; increase your weekly study time if you fall behind schedule. The course will expire a year after enrollment. You may petition for an extension; a $50 fee will apply if approved. If you don't complete the course, you can request to drop it.



Important - If your school gives you a date for the course to be completed, you must work to their deadline.  
Here is our suggested timeline for completing the course. We recommend you print it and stick it on the front cover of your notebook, to help you
    stay on track.


    
        
            
                 
            
            
                Activity
            
            
                Reading
            
        
        
            
                    Week 1
                
            
                Lessons 1.1 to 1.3
            
            The Most Dangerous Game;The Cask of Amontillado
        
        
            
                Week 2
            
            
                Lessons 1.4 to 1.6
            
            
                "Everyday Use"
            
        
        
            
                Week 3
            
            
                Unit 1 Assignment & Test
            
            
                Start American Born Chinese - Chapters 1-4
            
        
        
            
                Week 4
            
            
                Lessons 2.1 to 2.2
            
            
                Finish American Born Chinese - Chapters 5-9
            
        
        
            
                Week 5
            
            
                Lessons 2.3 to 2.6
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 6
            
            
                Unit 2 Assignment & Test
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 7
            
            
                Lessons 3.1 to 3.3
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 8
            
            
                Lessons 3.4 to 3.6
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 9
            
            
                Unit 3 Assignment & Test
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 10
            
            
                Lessons 4.1 to 4.2
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 11
            
            
                Lessons 4.3 to 4.4
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 12
            
            
                Unit 4 Assignment & Test
            
            
                Read Romeo and Juliet Act I
            
        
        
            
                Week 13
            
            
                Lessons 5.1 to 5.2
            
            
                Read Romeo and Juliet Act II
            
        
        
            
                Week 14
            
            
                Lesson 5.3 
            
            
                Read Romeo and Juliet Act III
            
        
        
            
                Week 15
            
            
                Lesson 5.4
            
            
                Read Romeo and Juliet Act IV
            
        
        
            
                Week 16
            
            
                Lesson 5.5
            
            
                Read Romeo and Juliet Act V 
            
        
        
            
                Week 17
            
            
                Unit 5 Assignment & Test
            
            
                 
            
        
        
            
                Week 18
            
            
                Practice Final & Final Exam
            
            
                 
            
        
    




* Print version
Please see our Policies page for more details on our extension policy (2.6).Last modified: Saturday, 3 May 2025, 6:15 PM

                    Quiz 1.3
                    1.4 Characterization and Setting
                    Quiz 1.4
                    1.5 Alice Walker - "Everyday Use"
                    Quiz 1.5

                    Quiz 2.1
                    2.2 "Show and Tell" - Graphic Essay

                    2.3 Archetypes in Literature

                    2.4 Identity: Who am I?
                    Quiz 2.4
                    2.5 Culture: Who are we?
                    Quiz 2.5
                    2.6 Literacy Narrative: How does language define us?
                    Quiz 2.6
                    Unit 2 Assignment: Graphic Literacy Narrative
                    Unit 2 Test
                    Unit 3 Study Guide
                    3.1 Writing Claims
                    Quiz 3.1
                    3.2 Logical Reasoning
                    Quiz 3.2

                    4.2 Poet vs. Speaker
                    Quiz 4.2
                    4.3 Types of Imagery
                    Quiz 4.3
                    4.4 The Sonnet
                    Quiz 4.4
                    Unit 4 Assignment: Analyzing a Sonnet
                    Unit 4 Test
                    Unit 5 Study Guide

                    Quiz 5.1
                    5.2 The Role of Language in Shakespeare
                    Quiz 5.2
                    5.3 Figurative Language
                    Quiz 5.3
                    5.4 Dualities, Juxaposition, and Foils
                    Quiz 5.4
                    5.5 Types of Irony
                    Quiz 5.5
                    Unit 5 Assignment: Tracking Chart and Synthesis Writing
                    Unit 5 Test
                    Reattempt up to 2 Unit Tests
                    Practice Final
                    Course Feedback
                    Request a Transcript

How This Course Works & Suggested Timeline

Completion requirements

SVHS courses are broken down into units; we recommend that you focus on each unit at a time; don't move on to the next unit until you have completed all the quizzes, submitted your unit assignment, and taken your unit test.  Focusing on each unit will help you remember it better.  Do the unit assignment before the unit test; the assignment requires you to apply the information you learned in the unit, and you'll be better prepared for the test.  

Here is a brief overview of how our courses work:

Suggested Timeline For Taking The Course

All our courses are self-paced; students can take them over a minimum of 30 days or a maximum of a year. Many students take the course over the summer, while others take it over a semester. The timeline below assumes the course is being taken over a regular semester of 18 weeks. If you want to take this over the summer, adjust the timeline, do 2-3 weeks of work per week, and complete the course in 6-9 weeks.

To complete this course over one semester (18 weeks), you should complete a unit every 2-3 weeks and spend 4 hours a week on the course. Remember, every student is different; increase your weekly study time if you fall behind schedule. The course will expire a year after enrollment. You may petition for an extension; a $50 fee will apply if approved. If you don't complete the course, you can request to drop it.

Important - If your school gives you a date for the course to be completed, you must work to their deadline.  

Here is our suggested timeline for completing the course. We recommend you print it and stick it on the front cover of your notebook, to help you stay on track.

The Cask of Amontillado

Start American Born Chinese - Chapters 1-4

Week 4

Lessons 2.1 to 2.2

Finish American Born Chinese - Chapters 5-9
